title: Aldon Lynn Nielsen
text:
Aldon Lynn Nielsen (born 1950 <a href="Grand%20Island%2C%20Nebraska">Grand Island, Nebraska</a>) is an American <a href="poet">poet</a>, and literary critic.
Life.
He was raised in the <a href="District%20of%20Columbia">District of Columbia</a>, where he graduated from the <a href="Federal%20City%20College">Federal City College</a> and from the <a href="George%20Washington%20University">George Washington University</a>, with a Ph.D. 
He taught at <a href="Howard%20University">Howard University</a>, <a href="San%20Jose%20State%20University">San Jose State University</a>, the <a href="University%20of%20California%2C%20Los%20Angeles">University of California, Los Angeles</a> and <a href="Loyola%20Marymount%20University">Loyola Marymount University</a>. He is the George and Barbara Kelly Professor of American Literature in the <a href="Pennsylvania%20State%20University">Pennsylvania State University</a>.
He lives in Pennsylvania and California, where his wife, Anna Everett, teaches at <a href="U.C.%20Santa%20Barbara">U.C. Santa Barbara</a>. Nielsen loves to wear hats and owns several tablets.
